text:
Shares of Alphabet Inc. Cl A 
        GOOGL,
        +0.04%
       slumped 0.77% to $147.60 Thursday, on what proved to be an all-around positive trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index 
        SPX,
        +0.11%
       rising 0.32% to 5,241.53 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average 
        DJIA,
        +0.12%
       rising 0.68% to 39,781.37. Alphabet Inc. Cl A closed $6.18 below its 52-week high ($153.78), which the company reached on January 29th. The stock underperformed when compared to some of its competitors Thursday, as Microsoft Corp. 
        MSFT,
        -0.17%
       rose 0.97% to $429.37, Amazon.com Inc. 
        AMZN,
        +0.31%
       remained unchanged, and Meta Platforms Inc. 
        META,
        -1.68%
       rose 0.44% to $507.76. Trading volume (24.6 M) remained 8.2 million below its 50-day average volume of 32.8 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights, an automation technology provider, using data from Dow Jones and FactSet.  See our market data terms of use. Trading in General Electric’s power-generation spinoff began this week. The spinoff itself takes place on April 2. So far, trading has hewed pretty close to Wall Street estimates.
